title: [BUG] libSkiaSharp.framework.dSYM missing
body:
### Description

When I create an ipa file it does not include the libSkiaSharp.framework.dSYM symbols

### Code

The best way to share code for larger projects is a link to a GitHub repository: https://github.com/user/repo/tree/bug-123

But, you can also share a short block of code here:
```cs
// some C# code here
```
You can also share some XAML:
```xaml
<!-- xaml code here -->
```


### Expected Behavior

I expected it to be either generated by visual studio and tried several configurations to no avail and also I would have expected the symbols file would be part of the nuget packages for the platoforms

### Actual Behavior

no symbols available in the build output

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)

### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp

2.88.9 (Previous)

### IDE / Editor

Visual Studio (Windows)

### Platform / Operating System

Android, iOS, Windows

### Platform / Operating System Version

Windows 11

### Devices

windows 11 pc

### Relevant Screenshots

_No response_

### Relevant Log Output

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

comments.author: bcaceiro
comments.body: Also facing this message when submitting an .ipa to AppStore

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body: Has any thing been done about this issue I am blocked

comments.author: NeuralDynamics
comments.body: I am blocked as well, any updates?

comments.author: mchiz
comments.body: Same here.

comments.author: afnsvdan
comments.body: Same here.

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body: there is no support do we have to use it?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I am having a look at a way to publish the symbols as part of the framework that is included in the app. Hopefully this makes life much easier for everyone.

One thing I have to check is if Apple is actually blocking the uploads witout symbols? Is it _just_ the skia symbols missing, or are the app symbols missing too?

comments.author: NeuralDynamics
comments.body:
As far as I can tell, its just the skia symbols. I haven't had the issue with anything else.
And yes, Apple is blocking the uploads without the symbols. Only way around it is to set it so it won't trim anything, but that leads to other unintended issues (like all of a sudden Calendar & Bluetooth access consent are required)

comments.author: bcaceiro
comments.body:
From my experience, it is not a blocker, since Apple is accepting the build - however there always the warning. 

@mattleibow  It is just the Skia symbols 

For reference I'm using these packages:

```
        <PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp" Version="3.118.0-preview.2.3" />
        <PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Extended.UI.Maui" Version="3.0.0-preview.13" />
```

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
OK, that is good to know. I think I got the symbols in the packages so hopefully once https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/pull/3184 finishes building you can test the artifacts?

I am switching to the different xcframework format which can contain the debug symbols and the release binaries. Should not make much of a difference to the app as the build process does the extraction and everything, but it is not 100% the same as before.

Let me know if you are able to test the packages!

comments.author: bcaceiro
comments.body: @mattleibow  can you tell me how to do it? No promises of when, since I'm going on a business trip, but whenever possible I can try it out.

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body: do we have a new nuget package?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
To test, download the nuget artifact from https://dev.azure.com/xamarin/6fd3d886-57a5-4e31-8db7-52a1b47c07a8/_build/results?buildId=136992

Extract to a folder and then add that folder as a nuget source in VS or in a nuget.config:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget-skia-pr" value="/path/to/nuget/folder" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body: I am desperate to launch my app when is the final fix going to be  available please . I am blocked. Do I have to use it ? is there an alternative?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Are you not able to publish at all? Can you send a screenshot of the errors? 

> From my experience, it is not a blocker, since Apple is accepting the build - however there always the warning. 
> 
> @mattleibow  It is just the Skia symbols 
> 
> For reference I'm using these packages:
> 
> ```
>         <PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp" Version="3.118.0-preview.2.3" />
>         <PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Extended.UI.Maui" Version="3.0.0-preview.13" />
> ```

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body: Unfortunately we are not able to use preview version at present. When is the fix going to be released ? any idea? Thanks for the help

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
If you are using the latest stable, is apple blogging you or warning you?

Can you share your error message or screenshot.

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body: Ok There is a new nuget released I will try it and let you know

comments.author: petemihaylov
comments.body: Same issue that we started getting recently. Its not blocking just warnings.

comments.author: Danvdh87
comments.body: I'm running into the same issue when trying to validate the archive from within TestFlight. **Version of SkiaSharp** 3.119.0 **IDE / Editor** Visual Studio (Windows 11) **Target OS** iOS **Dotnet Version** 9.0.304 **Message** Upload Symbols Failed The archive did not include a dSYM for the libSkiaSharp.framework with the UUIDs [F72282BC-1846-3669-A974-5CFF7806A45D]. Ensure that the archive's dSYM folder includes a DWARF file for libSkiaSharp.framework with the expected UUIDs. Any suggestions or workarounds would be really appreciated.

comments.author: joehanna
comments.body: This is still happening for me, I am not even referencing Skia directly - it is included in MAUI.

comments.author: ltemimi
comments.body:
I ingnored the error and deployed using transporter to deploy and it seems to work  after  I set  IpaThinning  to None ```<IpaThinning>None</IpaThinning>```

hope it will help
Laz
